to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast

sentences.english: Crystal base, foil glittering and translucent get rid of whole product extremely smart showily.
sentences.chinese: 水晶底座晶瑩剔透，烘托整個產品極其醒目華貴。

sentences.english: When landscaping around granite, plants are chosen to contract the stone.
sentences.chinese: 花崗石常作爲主景雕塑，植物配置起烘托的作用。

sentences.english: Percussion performances contrast, gag, noise called into play.
sentences.chinese: 表演時鑼鼓烘托，插科打諢，喧呼成戲。

sentences.english: The foil brilliant-colored brocade effectively, apply colours to a drawing of the plot.
sentences.chinese: 雲錦有力地烘托了人物，渲染了劇情的氣氛。

sentences.english: The decorations are usually sparse and are only meant to highlight the atmosphere that is being created by the music.
sentences.chinese: 裝飾通常稀稀落落以烘托音樂製造的氛圍。

sentences.english: These small games can foil the festive atmosphere of the compotation well.
sentences.chinese: 這些小遊戲能夠很好的烘托酒宴的熱鬧氣氛。

sentences.english: Extraordinary Barbecued flavor from the smoking process.
sentences.chinese: 燒烤煙薰烘托出來的燒烤香氣，風味特別。

sentences.english: Another important color association is that related to the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 色彩的另一個重要功能是烘托節日氛圍。

sentences.english: Accompanied with romanticism accompany the body elements to heighten the plot.
sentences.chinese: 配以具有浪漫主義的陪體元素來烘托情節。

sentences.english: The tops of the hills stood sharply like cruel teeth against the sky.
sentences.chinese: 山頂很尖，在天空的烘托下似乎一排排獠牙。

definition: to set off/to highlight by contrast
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
rendering (computing)/to add washes of ink or color to a drawing (Chinese painting)/to exaggerate/to embellish
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
to explain all the details/complete narrative
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
